# Exercise 1

Let $X$ be a discrete random variable over the set 
${5, 6, 7, 8}$. The distribution $\mathcal{v}$ of $X$ is defined by
$\mathbb{P}[X = 5] = 0.4, \mathbb{P}[X = 6] = 0.2, \mathbb{P}[X = 7] = 0.3, \mathbb{P}[X = 8] = 0.1$

Simulate a sample $x$ of 10000 i.i.d. random variables following the distribution $\mathcal{v}$ using the inverse transform method.
function method.

Let $U_n$ a sample of Uniform $\mathcal{U}([0,1])$
```{r}
n <- 10000
U <- runif(n)

f <- function(u){
  if (u <= 0.4){
    return(5)
  }
  if (u <= 0.6){
    return(6)
  }
  if (u <= 0.9){
    return(7)
  }
  return(8)
}

f_vectorise <- Vectorize(f)

X <- f_vectorise(U)

X_opti <- sample(5:8, n, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.4,0.2,0.3,0.1))
```

```{r}
hist(X)
hist(X_opti)
```
